newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee closes down in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee closes down in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.02 down at 39.10 to the dollar in the kerb market on Thursday on fears of further depreciation that spurred buying of the U.S. currency, dealers said.
They said the rupee was likely to open further lower on Saturday after Friday's weekend closure.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate remained unchanged at 35.5300/35.7077 to the dollar set on August 13.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 9.70 percent, compared to the opening at 9.80 percent.
